schema.name: mAdminState
schema.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
schema.label: Enable administrative state
schema.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
schema.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>
A descriptive summary for the configuration.
schema.summary: Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
schema.name: UserSummary
LocalAddress
schema.summary: Enter the IP address or host alias on which the HTTPS handler listens.
schema.label: IP address
schema.hoverhelp: Enter the IP address or host alias on which the HTTPS handler listens. The default value indicates that The handler listens on all IPv4 addresses.
schema.description: The address on which the HTTPS handler listens. The default value 0.0.0.0 indicates that The handler listens on all IPv4 addresses.

schema.name: LocalPort
schema.summary: Enter the port on which the HTTPS handler listens.
schema.hoverhelp: Enter the port on which the HTTPS handler listens. The default value is 443.
schema.description: The port on which the HTTPS handler listens. The default value is 443.

schema.name: HTTPVersion
schema.summary: Set the HTTP version for client side connections.
schema.description: The HTTP version for client side connections. The default value is HTTP 1.1. For the HTTP/2 protocol, requests and responses are always HTTP/2. When HTTP/2, this setting is ignored.

schema.name: AllowedFeatures

value.summary: Allow requests with any other method, which supports protocol extensions
value.name: CustomMethods

value.summary: Allow requests when the URL contains a ?
value.name: QueryString

value.summary: Allow requests when the URL contains a #
value.name: FragmentIdentifiers

value.summary: Allow requests when the URL contains a ..
value.name: DotDot

value.summary: Allow requests when the URL path contains a ..
value.name: DotDotInPath

value.summary: Allow requests when the query string contains a ..
value.name: DotDotInQueryString

value.summary: Allow requests when the URL contains cmd.exe
value.name: CmdExe

schema.summary: Set the methods and versions to allow for incoming requests.
schema.description: The methods and versions to allow for incoming requests.

schema.name: PersistentConnections
schema.summary: Indicate whether to negotiate persistent client side connections.
schema.description: Whether to negotiate persistent client side connections. The default is enabled. The HTTP/2 protocol controls persistent connections and reuse. Therefore, these settings are ignored.

schema.name: MaxPersistentConnectionsReuse
schema.summary: Enter the maximum number of times a persistent client side connection is reused.
schema.description: The maximum number of times a persistent client side connection is reused. When the maximum reuse count is reached, an explicit <tt>HTTP Connection: close</tt> header is sent in the response, and the TCP connection is closed. The default value is 0, which means unlimited reuse.

schema.name: AllowCompression
schema.summary: Indicate whether to negotiate GZIP compression for client side connections.
schema.description: <p>Whether to negotiate GZIP compression for client side connections.</p><p>The default is disabled. If enabled, the DataPower service uses GZIP to compress HTTP transmissions when the <tt>Accept-Encoding</tt> HTTP header indicates that compressed documents can be processed.</p><p>The <tt>Transfer-Encoding</tt> HTTP header indicates compression.</p>

schema.name: AllowWebSocketUpgrade
schema.summary: Indicate whether to allow WebSocket upgrade requests from clients.
schema.description: Whether to allow WebSocket upgrade requests from clients. The default is disabled. This request is to switch the existing connection to use the WebSocket protocol. WebSocket upgrade requests require that The handler allows GET methods.

schema.name: WebSocketIdleTimeout
schema.summary: Enter the maximum idle time for client connections.
schema.description: The maximum idle time for client connections. This timer monitors the idle time in the data transfer process. When the specified idle time is exceeded, the connection is torn down. Enter a value in the range 0 - 86400. The default value is 0, which indicates that the timer is disabled.

schema.name: MaxURLLen
schema.summary: Enter the length of the longest incoming URL to accept.
schema.description: The length of the longest incoming URL to accept. The length includes any query string or fragment identifier. Enter a value in the range 1 - 128000. The default value is 16384.

schema.name: MaxTotalHdrLen
schema.summary: Enter the maximum aggregate length of HTTP headers to allow.
schema.description: The maximum aggregate length of HTTP headers to allow. Enter a value in the range 5 - 128000. The default value is 128000.

schema.name: MaxHdrCount
schema.summary: Enter the maximum number of headers to allow in client requests.
schema.description: The maximum number of headers to allow in client requests. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

schema.name: MaxNameHdrLen
schema.summary: Enter the maximum length of a header name to allow in client requests.
schema.description: The maximum length of a header name to allow in client requests. Each HTTP header is expressed as a name-value pair. This setting sets the maximum length of the name portion of a header. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

schema.name: MaxValueHdrLen
schema.summary: Enter the maximum length of a header value to allow in client requests.
schema.description: The maximum length of a header value to allow in client requests. Each HTTP header is expressed as a name-value pair. This setting sets the maximum length of the value portion of a header. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

schema.name: MaxQueryStringLen
schema.summary: Enter the maximum length of the query string to allow in client requests.
schema.description: The maximum length of the query string to allow in client requests. The query string is the portion of the URL after the question mark (?) character. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.
The access control list uses the defined client IP addresses to allow or deny access.
schema.summary: Assign the access control list.
schema.name: ACL
CredentialCharset
schema.summary: Set the character encoding of the original basic authentication values.

value.summary: Windows Central European and Eastern European
value.name: cp1250

value.summary: ISO-8859-1 Latin 1 including Albanian, Catalan, Danish, Dutch, English, Finnish, French, German, Italian, Norwegian, Portuguese, Spanish, and Swedish
value.name: iso8859_1

value.summary: ISO-8859-2 including Bosnian, Croatian, Czech, Hungarian, Polish, Romanian, Slovakian, and Slovenian
value.name: iso8859_2

value.summary: ISO-8859-4 including Estonian, Greenlandic, Latvian, Lithuanian, and Sami
value.name: iso8859_4

value.summary: ISO-8859-5 including Belarusian, Bulgarian, Kazakh, Macedonian, Russian, Serbian, Turkish, and Ukrainian
value.name: iso8859_5

schema.description: The character encoding of the original basic authentication values. Basic authentication credentials are combined and base64 encoded in the authorization header of the request. The DataPower Gateway transcodes the contents of the authorization header to UTF-8. The default value represents ISO-8859-1 Latin 1.

schema.name: SSLProxy
schema.summary: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use a TLS server profile or TLS SNI server profile.
schema.description: The TLS proxy profile with the cryptographic profiles to secure connections.

schema.name: SSLServerConfigType
schema.summary: Set the TLS profile type to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway
schema.description: The TLS profile type to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway.

schema.name: SSLServer
schema.summary: Set the TLS server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway
schema.description: <p>The TLS server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway.</p><p><b>Note:</b> The TLS server profile that secures the HTTP/2 connection must use the TLS 1.2 or better protocol with a cipher that is secure according to RFC 7540.</p>

schema.name: SSLSNIServer
schema.summary: Set the TLS SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway
schema.description: <p>The TLS SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway.</p><p><b>Note:</b> The TLS SNI server profile that secures the HTTP/2 connection must use the TLS 1.2 or better protocol with a cipher that is secure according to RFC 7540.</p>

schema.name: HTTP2MaxStreams
schema.summary: Enter the maximum number of current streams that a client can have
schema.description: <p>The maximum number of concurrent streams that the client can have outstanding at the same time with The handler. The limit applies to the number of streams that the client allows the target to create.</p><p>The greater the number of streams in use, the more resources the client uses. Resources include memory and the network connections to the destination.</p><p>Enter a value in the range 1 - 500. The default value is 100.</p>

schema.name: HTTP2MaxFrameSize
schema.summary: Enter the largest payload frame size that clients can send
schema.description: The largest payload frame size that the client can send. Enter a value in the range 16384 - 16777215. The default value is 16384.

schema.name: HTTP2StreamHeader
schema.summary: Whether to enable the HTTP/2 stream identifier header in the request or response
schema.description: <p>Indicates whether to enable the HTTP/2 stream identifier header in the request or response. When enabled, the HTTP/2 stream identifier is included in the <tt>X-DP-http2-stream</tt> header. With this header, you can correlate the HTTP/2 stream. The default behavior is disabled.</p>

schema.name: ChunkedEncoding
schema.summary: Whether to enable the responses to use Transfer-Encoding: chunked
schema.description: When enabled, the HTTP response will use Transfer-Encoding: chunked. The default behavior is enabled.
